.
Representation for Claimants in the Process of Being Declared Incompetent
Until a fiduciary is appointed for a claimant in the process of being declared incompetent, accept the appointment of a representative from any of the following people in the following order
claimant
claimant’s guardian
spouse
parent
other relative or friend (if interests are not adverse), or
director of the hospital in which the claimant is maintained.
Once VA appoints a fiduciary, the fiduciary may appoint a new POA representative.  The prior representative is
not
automatically revoked.
References
:  For more information on
signature requirements when appointing a representative, see
38 CFR 14.631(a)(1)
, and
M21-1, Part I, Subpart i, 2.C.1.e
, and
representation of beneficiaries in the fiduciary program, see
38 CFR 13.40
.
